# Anaconda Installation Guide for macOS

## Introduction

This guide will walk you through the process of installing Anaconda, a popular Python distribution, on your macOS computer. Anaconda provides a convenient way to manage Python packages and environments for data science and scientific computing.

## Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

1. A macOS computer.
2. An internet connection.
3. Sufficient disk space for the installation.

## Installation Steps

### 1. Download Anaconda

Visit the Anaconda download page at [https://www.anaconda.com/downloads](https://www.anaconda.com/downloads).

### 2. Choose the macOS Installer

Click on the "Download" button under the macOS section depending on you System-on-chip (**Intel/M1/M2**) to download the Anaconda installer for macOS.

![Download Anaconda](images/screenshots/1.png)

### 3. Run the Installer

- Locate the downloaded file (usually in your "Downloads" folder).
- Double-click the Anaconda disk image (`.dmg`) file to open it and click on "Allow" when prompted.

![Run Installer](images/screenshots/2.png)

![Allow Installation](images/screenshots/3.png)

### 4. Follow the Installer Wizard

- Follow the on-screen instructions to begin the installation.
- Read and accept the license agreement when prompted.

![Read Me](images/screenshots/4.png)

![License Agreement](images/screenshots/5.png)

<!-- - Choose the installation type. It's recommended to select "Install for me only" unless you have specific reasons for a different choice. -->

<!-- ![Installation Type](path/to/screenshot-4.png) -->

<!-- - Select the installation location (the default is usually fine). -->

<!-- ![Installation Location](path/to/screenshot-5.png) -->

### 5. Install Anaconda

Click the "Install" button to begin the installation process. This may take a few minutes.

![Install](images/screenshots/6.png)

### 6. Complete the Installation

Once the installation is complete, you will see a confirmation message. Click the "Continue" button and finally close the installation wizard by clicking on the "Close" button.

![Installation Complete](images/screenshots/7.png)

![Close Installation Wizard](images/screenshots/8.png)

### 7. Move the Installer file to Trash **(Optional)**

![Move the Installer to Trash](images/screenshots/9.png)

### 8. If prompted to update the navigator, select "No, don't show again"

![Don't Update](images/screenshots/10.png)

### 9. You're <u>NOT REQUIRED</u> to Log in/Sign up for Anaconda Cloud, you can close the prompt by clicking the "x" button

![Don't Log in/Sign up](images/screenshots/13.png)

### 10. Verify the Installation

Open the "Terminal" application on your macOS computer and type the following command to verify that Anaconda and Jupyter were installed successfully:

```bash
jupyter --version
```

![Open Terminal](images/screenshots/11.png)

![Verify Jupyter Installation](images/screenshots/12.png)


You should see the Jupyter packages version numbers displayed.

## Conclusion

Congratulations! You've successfully installed Anaconda and Jupyter on your macOS computer. You can now use Anaconda to create Python environments, manage packages, and work on data science projects.

For more information on using Anaconda, refer to the official documentation at [https://docs.anaconda.com/](https://docs.anaconda.com/).

If you encounter any issues or have questions, don't hesitate to seek help from the Anaconda community or consult the documentation for troubleshooting tips.
